TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TreeViewHitTestInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains information about an area of a control or a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewHitTestInfo> is returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> class when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.HitTest%2A> method is called.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewHitTestInfo> class. To run this example, paste the following code into a Windows Form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> control named `treeView1`, and populate the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> with items. Ensure that `treeview1` and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseDown> event for the form are associated with the `HandleMouseDown` method.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System.Windows.Forms/PictureBox/CancelAsync/Form1.cs" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewPictureBoxWhidbeyMembers/VB/Form1.vb" id="Snippet1":::

Docs.summary: Gets the location of a hit test on a control, in relation to the and the nodes it contains.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewHitTestInfo.Location%2A> property. To run this example, paste the following code into a Windows Form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> control named `treeView1`, and populate the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> with items. Ensure that `treeview1` and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseDown> event for the form are associated with the `HandleMouseDown` method.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System.Windows.Forms/PictureBox/CancelAsync/Form1.cs" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewPictureBoxWhidbeyMembers/VB/Form1.vb" id="Snippet1":::

Docs.summary: Gets the at the position indicated by a hit test of a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the hit test location is not on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode>, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewHitTestInfo.Node%2A> property will be `null`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewHitTestInfo.Node%2A> property. To run this example, create a Windows Form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> named `treeView1`, and populate it with several levels of nodes. Paste the following code into a form, and associate the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseDown> event of `treeView1` with the `treeView1_MouseDown` method.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewWhidbeyMembers/cpp/Form1.cpp" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System.Windows.Forms/TreeNode/ToolTipText/Form1.cs" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.TreeViewWhidbeyMembers/VB/Form1.vb" id="Snippet3":::
